description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
presentation of the experiment to the participants – all motivational trials lasted 120 seconds even when all 5 grapes were attained earlier
test conditions presented to the participant - two experimental failed-look and successful-look and one motivational - participants received maximum 5 grapes per session

time (in seconds) at which a pointing gesture begins
For coding purposes a pointing gesture includes extending a finger/hand/arm through the wire-mesh experimental window and directing it beyond without requiring eye contact with the experimenter. This definition applies to all subsequent variables that include pointing gesture
time (in seconds) at which a pointing gesture ends
duration of a pointing gesture in seconds (end_time_s minus start_time_s)
whether the pointing gesture is left-handed or right-handed
whether the participant made eye contact with the gestural recipient when pointing.
the location where a pointing gesture is directed relative to the experimenter
The location of the grapes relative to the experimenter
whether the pointing gesture is directed at the grapes (point_direction and grape_position match) or not (point_direction and grape_position fail to match)
whether the participant received a grape or grapeless grapevine.
which of three experimenters ran the trial.
